sect1.title: mdadm-&mdadm-version;

sect2.title: Kernel Configuration
sect2.para: Enable the following options in the kernel configuration and recompile the kernel, if necessary. Only the RAID types desired are required.

screen.literal: Device Drivers ---> [*] Multiple devices driver support (RAID and LVM) ---> [CONFIG_MD] <*> RAID support [CONFIG_BLK_DEV_MD] [*] Autodetect RAID arrays during kernel boot [CONFIG_MD_AUTODETECT] <*/M> Linear (append) mode [CONFIG_MD_LINEAR] <*/M> RAID-0 (striping) mode [CONFIG_MD_RAID0] <*/M> RAID-1 (mirroring) mode [CONFIG_MD_RAID1] <*/M> RAID-10 (mirrored striping) mode [CONFIG_MD_RAID10] <*/M> RAID-4/RAID-5/RAID-6 mode [CONFIG_MD_RAID456]

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: make everything: This target creates extra programs, particularly a statically-linked version of mdadm and also versions of mdassemble. These all need to be manually installed.

listitem.para: manages MD devices aka Linux Software RAID.
is a tiny program that can be used to assemble MD devices inside an initial ramdisk (initrd) or initramfs.
